Join us for a day of peaceful action.
 ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

The right to join with friends and neighbors in protest or peaceful assembly is critical to a functioning democracy and a right guaranteed by the Constitution. That's why we're taking South Dakota to court and will be rallying in the streets on Wednesday. Our voices won't be silenced — and we want you to join us!

The U.S. District Court in Rapid City will hear the case challenging three South Dakota laws, including the newly-enacted “Riot Boosting” Act that threaten activists who encourage or organize protests at 3 p.m. this Wednesday, June 12.

Before the lawyers make their arguments in front of the judge, we'll be gathering in Rapid City for a day of peaceful action with organizations like Dakota Rural Action, NDN Collective, Black Hills Clean Water Alliance, the Indigenous Environmental Network and the Sierra Club South Dakota. Join us and let us know you'll be there on the Facebook event page.

Tuesday, June 11

  • 3 to 8 p.m. – Art build and poster making (feel free to bring a potluck dish to share!) at NDN Collective, 317 Main St.

Wednesday, June 12

  • 11:30 a.m. – More poster making at NDN Collective.
  • 12:30 p.m. – Formal gathering begins with pre-march prayers and drumming at NDN Collective.
  • 1 p.m. – March from NDN Collective to the U.S. Courthouse.
  • 1:15 p.m. – Rally begins at the U.S. Courthouse, 515 Ninth St., with speakers from each organization and a pre-hearing prayer.
  • 2:15 p.m. – Enter the courthouse and fill up the hearing room (read our FAQ on the hearing).
  • 3 p.m. – Hearing begins.

Can't make it to Rapid City? Get social with us and join our online rally!

Add a rally frame to your Facebook profile picture, share our posts on the case, and use the hashtag #NoKXLDakota on Twitter. Then, tune at 11:30 a.m. Central/12:30 p.m. Mountain Wednesday to catch a livestreamed video of the Protect the Protectors rally on Facebook.

Thanks for sticking with us,

Sabrina King
Director of Campaigns, ACLU of South Dakota
